results.text: The invisible effects of good and evil become visible to you. For the next minute, all Good and Evil aligned creatures produce a visible aura. This aura is only visible to you, and it only tells you the creature’s alignment.
Either through your knowledge or your faith, your knowledge of religion and its practices is vast. You have advantage on your next Religion check.

Your senses temporarily extend to the divine, enabling you to see what others can’t. You are under the effects of the spell @UUID[Compendium.a5e.a5e-spells.Item.jlqrjd03lyl8zb3c]{Detect Evil and Good} for the next 10 minutes.

You have learned to reliably identify the iconography or symbolism of not just your own deity or religious order but of many others. For the next hour you gain an expertise die on checks made to identify or contextualize any religious symbols you find.
You have spent many hours studying the religions and theocracies of the world, giving you greater insight. You gain one piece of Key Knowledge related to the topic.

Different religions have different rites and you have learned a few in your travels. You accurately recreate a rite for the associated deity and gain their blessing. The Narrator rolls a [[/r 1d12 #1d12]] on the Blessing Boons table from the Boons and Discoveries section found in Trials & Treasures.
